result.execSummary:
Marcus A Gallegos was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Marcus A Gallegos was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus A Gallegos

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Marcus A Gallegos
Current: 215 Rice St, Grand Junction, CO 81501 United States  (Effective: 04-18-2022)
Prior: 625 Chipeta Avenue, Grand Junction, CO 81501

1:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Marcus A Gallegos appeared in court from the Dunn County jail. Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF40, 22TR753, 22TR754, 22TR755
Atty Tomtschik - De will waive extradition.
DE - agrees to waive extradition.
Court - advises DE of extradition rights.
DE - signs extradition paperwork.
Court - signs extradition paperwork. 
State - asks for Pre trial date RE: traffic forf unless DE wants to plea. 
State - 22TR754 Plea to OWI(1) fine $811.50. 6 mo revo DL. No IID. AODA. 
DE - enters plea of No Contest to 22TR754.
Court - finds DE guilty 22TR754 and orders fine $811.50. 6 month revocation of DL. No IID. AODA. 22TR755 and 22TR754 are dismissed.
Copy of Warrant and Waiver from Colorado
